ext_descriptions.ext_description: The approval has the implication that the contents are suitable for the purpose of the message. The approval of the list of intended recipients of the message is held against Envelope.
This selects the contents elements that make up the message.

ext_description.note: Date_or_date_time_assignment.role allows the role of the assigment to be identified, for example, "date made".
This will allow the person, organisation or equipment that defined the message to be identified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: This enables a security classification to be applied to the message as a whole. The security classification of the collection of information may be higher than any of the individual elements of the message.

ext_description.note: The business process for creating, approving and processing a message can be mapped to a state model, hence assigning a series of states to a message allows an audit trail to be produced.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each Contents_entry provides a description of one of the contents elements pointed to via the message_contents_select. Although viewed from the point of view of the data model, this element is redundant, it fulfils an operational requirement to be able to identify the contents elements without actually reading them, on the analogy with e-mail attachments.

This provides a string used to reference the particular entry. The form of this entry depends on the operational characterisics of the systems involved. For example, the message may unzip itself into a web, and the contents_entry would contain the URL of the contents element.

This is used to aid access to the contents element. This is typically used to help the end user distinguish elements such as text, pictures, or automtically generated information, and hence decide whether to open then entry.
This is used to reference to the actual contents element to which the Contents_entry refers.

A Message is a collection of information, brought together by an originator (the message_definer) for some particular purpose, generally the fulfillment of a process. A Message is an historical record, intended to be sent using an and in consequence, is not versioned. The same Message can be sent several times using different Envelopes. Once it has been sent once, it cannot be further changed. However it should not remain unsent, since that is to confuse its functions and therefore its meaning with other entities such as one of the types of document.
The contains attribute links the Message to its contents.

Each contains_items attribute corresponds to a contains attribute, implying that the message contents include the item described in the Contents_entry. See note on Contents_entry for the explaination of this redundancy.
This identifies who (person or person-in-organisation) or what defined the message, that is, identified its purpose and contents.
Identifier of the message. The identifier should be unique, however, given the scope of message, there is no meaningful way of specifying that uniqueness within the standard.

This identifies the general purpose of the message, allowing it to be differentiated from other types of message, and so be handled appropriately. The contents of this entity are defined through reference data. The following gives an example of reference data for message_type:
field input - used to identify data acquired directly from the environment, e.g. on a maintenance engineer's palm top.
synchronisation - used to indicate that the attached data has been changed in the originator's data base, and should be used to update the recipients database
action required - used to prompt the recipient to respond to the contents of the reports
urgent action required - as above, but with a high priority
Purpose provides an optional, extended description of the purpose of the message. On the e-mail analogy, purpose is equivalent of the text of the message

Message_association provides a link between two related messages. The meaning of the association depends on Message_association.role. If Message.id=2 replaces Message.id=1, then Message_association.relating points to Message.id=2 and Message_association.related points to Message.id=1 with Message_association.role="replaces".
The related message. See example above.
